page.title: 19Devil's Water by Susan Reed.
page.content: In the valley deep, Like hidden treasure, Devil's Water flows, Across the stones and rocks, Through the pebbles and the sand. It tells stories of the past, I wonder which are true, I ask it, "Did you hear the cries of people, And horses dying, In the Battle of Hexham nearby? Up the hill, Under Linnel bridge, Endlessly flowing over rocks, Rounding pebbles, Making stones slippery, Gurgling,hurrying on its way, Until in triumph It reaches the Tyne. Susan Reed aged 9 years. Devil's Water means the river of the D'Eivilles,who lived at Dilston.
